level.text: The Director may require that the parties file, at least five (5) days prior to the hearing and on a form approved by the Director, the following information:
The name and address of each witness who may be called to testify during the hearing;
The name and address of each expert witness who may be called to testify, together with a copy of any written report prepared by that expert witness;
The approximate length of time required by each party to present its case during the hearing;
A certification by the person filing that a true copy of the filed document has been served on all parties; and
Any other information that the Director may determine to be necessary for the more efficient scheduling and operation of the hearing process.
The parties may enter stipulations into the record.
No pre-hearing filing shall be accepted within five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date without the authorization of the ALJ.
A request for continuance shall be submitted in writing.
